title: Biden’s ‘Made in America’ Policies Anger Key Allies
description: The president’s plans to bolster America’s electric vehicle and battery production have opened a rift in relationships in Asia and Europe.
dc:creator: Alan Rappeport, Ana Swanson and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
Office of the United States Trade Representative
media:credit: Brittany Greeson for The New York Times
media:description: A 2022 Ford F-150 Lightning, the automaker’s electric pickup truck, in production in Dearborn, Mich. At the center of the trade fight is the more than $50 billion in tax credits to entice Americans to buy electric vehicles, but only those that are assembled in North America.
